argument.name: target
argument.description: A row number (zero based) or a string representing the value returned by the List. For example, if the List is configured to return values from a 'Lastname' column, then you could set the target to 'Smith'.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Optional. An object with settings that control if the target row is at the top, bottom, or anywhere in-view, and whether the scroll should be animated. Properties of options include:

item.name: mode
item.description: The mode to use. Value can be 'top', 'bottom', or 'into-view'.

item.name: animation
item.description: An object defining whether or not to allow animations and length of the animation duration. See example below.

item.name: offset
item.description: Defines the x and y offset in pixels. See example below.

page.description: Scroll the List to bring a row into view.
